					<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading mw-first-heading"><span class="mw-page-title-main">2023 deaths in the United States</span></h1>
							
<div id="p-lang-btn" class="vector-dropdown mw-portlet mw-portlet-lang">
	<input type="checkbox" id="p-lang-btn-checkbox" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" data-event-name="ui.dropdown-p-lang-btn" class="vector-dropdown-checkbox mw-interlanguage-selector" aria-label="Go to an article in another language. Available in 1 language">
	<label id="p-lang-btn-label" for="p-lang-btn-checkbox" class="vector-dropdown-label cdx-button cdx-button--fake-button cdx-button--fake-button--enabled cdx-button--weight-quiet cdx-button--action-progressive mw-portlet-lang-heading-1" aria-hidden="true"><span class="vector-icon mw-ui-icon-language-progressive mw-ui-icon-wikimedia-language-progressive"></span>

	</label>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_in_the_United_States" title="2023 in the United States">2023 in the United States</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deaths_in_2023" class="mw-redirect" title="Deaths in 2023">Deaths in 2023</a></div>
<p>The following notable deaths in the <b>United States occurred in 2023</b>. Names are reported under the date of death, in alphabetical order as set out in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:NAMESORT" class="mw-redirect" title="Wikipedia:NAMESORT">WP:NAMESORT</a>.
A typical entry reports information in the following sequence:
Name, age, country of citizenship at birth and subsequent nationality 
(if applicable), what subject was noted for, year of birth (if known), 
and reference.
</p><p><br>
</p>
<meta property="mw:PageProp/toc">

<ul><li>January 1
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Davis_(mathematician)" title="Martin Davis (mathematician)">Martin Davis</a>, 94, mathematician (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Davis%E2%80%93Putnam_algorithm" title="DavisPutnam algorithm">DavisPutnam algorithm</a>) (b. 1928)<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gangsta_Boo" title="Gangsta Boo">Gangsta Boo</a>, 43, rapper (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_6_Mafia" title="Three 6 Mafia">Three 6 Mafia</a>) (b. 1979)<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>2<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edith_Lank" title="Edith Lank">Edith Lank</a>, 96, author and advice columnist (b. 1926)<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>3<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebastian_Marino" class="mw-redirect" title="Sebastian Marino">Sebastian Marino</a>, 57, guitarist (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overkill_(band)" title="Overkill (band)">Overkill</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anvil_(band)" title="Anvil (band)">Anvil</a>) (b. 1965)<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>4<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Art_McNally" title="Art McNally">Art McNally</a>, 97, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pro_Football_Hall_of_Fame" title="Pro Football Hall of Fame">Hall of Fame</a> football official, director of officiating for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Football_League" title="National Football League">NFL</a> (19681991) (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>5<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kelly_Monteith" title="Kelly Monteith">Kelly Monteith</a>, 80, comedian (b. 1942)<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>6<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meenakshi_Narain" title="Meenakshi Narain">Meenakshi Narain</a>, 58, experimental physicist (b. 1964)<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edith_Pearlman" title="Edith Pearlman">Edith Pearlman</a>, 86, short story writer (b. 1936)<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_White_(musician)" title="Fred White (musician)">Fred White</a>, 67, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame" title="Rock and Roll Hall of Fame">Hall of Fame</a> drummer (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth,_Wind_%26_Fire" title="Earth, Wind &amp; Fire">Earth, Wind &amp; Fire</a>) (b. 1955)<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>9<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>January 2
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lincoln_Almond" title="Lincoln Almond">Lincoln Almond</a>, 86, politician and lawyer, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Rhode_Island" title="Governor of Rhode Island">governor of Rhode Island</a> (19952003), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Attorney" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. Attorney">U.S. Attorney</a> for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_District_of_Rhode_Island" title="United States District Court for the District of Rhode Island">district of Rhode Island</a> (19691978; 19811993) (b. 1936)<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>10<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ken_Block" title="Ken Block">Ken Block</a>, 55, professional rally driver (b. 1967)<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>11<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suzy_McKee_Charnas" title="Suzy McKee Charnas">Suzy McKee Charnas</a>, 83, novelist (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Kingdom_of_Kevin_Malone" title="The Kingdom of Kevin Malone">The Kingdom of Kevin Malone</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Holdfast_Chronicles" title="The Holdfast Chronicles">The Holdfast Chronicles</a></i>) and short story writer ("<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boobs_(short_story)" title="Boobs (short story)">Boobs</a>") (b. 1939)<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>12<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molly_Corbett_Broad" title="Molly Corbett Broad">Molly Corbett Broad</a>, 81, academic administrator (b. 1941)<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>13<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buster_Corley" class="mw-redirect" title="Buster Corley">Buster Corley</a>, 72, restaurateur, co-founder of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_%26_Buster%27s" title="Dave &amp; Buster's">Dave &amp; Buster's</a> (b. 1950)<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>14<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catherine_David_(writer)" title="Catherine David (writer)">Catherine David</a>, 73, French-born literary critic and novelist (b. 1949)<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>15<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roxanne_Donnery" title="Roxanne Donnery">Roxanne Donnery</a>, 79, politician (b. 1943)<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>16<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cai_Emmons" title="Cai Emmons">Cai Emmons</a>, 71, author and blogger (b. 1951)<sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Galati" title="Frank Galati">Frank Galati</a>, 79, theatre director (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Grapes_of_Wrath_(play)" title="The Grapes of Wrath (play)">The Grapes of Wrath</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ragtime_(musical)" title="Ragtime (musical)">Ragtime</a></i>) and screenwriter (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Accidental_Tourist_(film)" title="The Accidental Tourist (film)">The Accidental Tourist</a></i>), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Awards" title="Tony Awards">Tony</a> winner (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/44th_Tony_Awards" title="44th Tony Awards">1990</a>) (b. 1943)<sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>18<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cliff_Gustafson" title="Cliff Gustafson">Cliff Gustafson</a>, 91, baseball coach (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas_Longhorns_baseball" title="Texas Longhorns baseball">Texas Longhorns</a>) (b. 1931)<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>19<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bobby_Hogue_(politician)" title="Bobby Hogue (politician)">Bobby Hogue</a>, 83, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arkansas_House_of_Representatives" title="Arkansas House of Representatives">Arkansas House of Representatives</a> (19791998) (b. 1939)<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>20<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_L._Hughes" title="Thomas L. Hughes">Thomas L. Hughes</a>, 97, government official, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assistant_Secretary_of_State_for_Intelligence_and_Research" title="Assistant Secretary of State for Intelligence and Research">director of the Bureau of Intelligence and Research</a> (19631969) (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>21<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marilyn_Stafford" title="Marilyn Stafford">Marilyn Stafford</a>, 97, American-born British photographer (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>22<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Stephan" title="Robert Stephan">Robert Stephan</a>, 89, lawyer, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansas_Attorney_General" title="Kansas Attorney General">Kansas attorney general</a> (19791995) (b. 1933)<sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-23"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>23<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>January 3
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_D._Brubaker" title="James D. Brubaker">James D. Brubaker</a>, 85, film producer (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Almighty" title="Bruce Almighty">Bruce Almighty</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocky_(franchise)" title="Rocky (franchise)">Rocky</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Right_Stuff_(film)" title="The Right Stuff (film)">The Right Stuff</a></i>) (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Cunningham" title="Walter Cunningham">Walter Cunningham</a>, 90, astronaut (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_7" title="Apollo 7">Apollo 7</a>) (b. 1932)<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bessie_Hendricks" class="mw-redirect" title="Bessie Hendricks">Bessie Hendricks</a>, 115, supercentenarian (b. 1907)<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>26<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greta_Kiernan" title="Greta Kiernan">Greta Kiernan</a>, 89, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Jersey_General_Assembly" title="New Jersey General Assembly">New Jersey General Assembly</a> (19781980) (b. 1933)<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Lowenstein" title="James Lowenstein">James Lowenstein</a>, 95, diplomat, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ambassadors_of_the_United_States_to_Luxembourg" title="List of ambassadors of the United States to Luxembourg">ambassador to Luxembourg</a> (19771981) (b. 1927)<sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_J._Marshall" title="Frederick J. Marshall">Frederick J. Marshall</a>, 71, judge, justice of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Supreme_Court" title="New York Supreme Court">New York Supreme Court</a> (20002022) (b. 1951)<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>29<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robbie_Pierce" title="Robbie Pierce">Robbie Pierce</a>, 63, off-road racing driver (b. 1959)<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nate_Thayer" title="Nate Thayer">Nate Thayer</a>, 62, journalist (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Far_Eastern_Economic_Review" title="Far Eastern Economic Review">Far Eastern Economic Review</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane%27s_Defence_Weekly" title="Jane's Defence Weekly">Jane's Defence Weekly</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_of_Fortune_(magazine)" title="Soldier of Fortune (magazine)">Soldier of Fortune</a></i>) (b. 1960)<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>January 4
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Duncan" title="Arthur Duncan">Arthur Duncan</a>, 97, tap dancer (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lawrence_Welk_Show" title="The Lawrence Welk Show">The Lawrence Welk Show</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Betty_White_Show_(1952_TV_series)" title="The Betty White Show (1952 TV series)">The Betty White Show</a></i>) (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Fruchter" title="Norman Fruchter">Norman Fruchter</a>, 85, writer and academic (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casey_Hayden" title="Casey Hayden">Casey Hayden</a>, 85, civil rights activist (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elwood_Hillis" title="Elwood Hillis">Elwood Hillis</a>, 96, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._House_of_Representatives" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. House of Representatives">U.S. House of Representatives</a> (19711987) (b. 1926)<sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<ul><li>February 1
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joanne_Bracker" title="Joanne Bracker">Joanne Bracker</a>, 77, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_Basketball_Hall_of_Fame" title="Women's Basketball Hall of Fame">Hall of Fame</a> college basketball coach (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midland_University" title="Midland University">Midland University</a>) (b. 1945)<sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>225<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Bramlett" title="Don Bramlett">Don Bramlett</a>, 60, football player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minnesota_Vikings" title="Minnesota Vikings">Minnesota Vikings</a>) (b. 1962)<sup id="cite_ref-226" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-226"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>226<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_Florence" title="Franklin Florence">Franklin Florence</a>, 88, civil rights activist (b. 1934)<sup id="cite_ref-227" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-227"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>227<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roland_Muhlen" title="Roland Muhlen">Roland Muhlen</a>, 80, Olympic sprint canoer (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canoeing_at_the_1972_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_C-2_1000_metres" title="Canoeing at the 1972 Summer Olympics  Men's C-2 1000 metres">1972</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canoeing_at_the_1976_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_C-2_500_metres" title="Canoeing at the 1976 Summer Olympics  Men's C-2 500 metres">1976</a>) (b. 1942)<sup id="cite_ref-228" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-228"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>228<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_P._Wilbur" title="George P. Wilbur">George P. Wilbur</a>, 81, actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halloween_4:_The_Return_of_Michael_Myers" title="Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers">Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halloween:_The_Curse_of_Michael_Myers" title="Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers">Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remote_Control_(1988_film)" title="Remote Control (1988 film)">Remote Control</a></i>) and stuntman (b. 1941)<sup id="cite_ref-229" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-229"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>229<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanley_Wilson_Jr." title="Stanley Wilson Jr.">Stanley Wilson Jr.</a>, 40, football player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit_Lions" title="Detroit Lions">Detroit Lions</a>) (b. 1982)<sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-230"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>230<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>February 2
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ron_Campbell_(baseball)" title="Ron Campbell (baseball)">Ron Campbell</a>, 82, baseball player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Cubs" title="Chicago Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a>) (b. 1940)<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-231"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>231<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Chesser" title="Chris Chesser">Chris Chesser</a>, 74, film producer (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_League_(film)" title="Major League (film)">Major League</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rundown" title="The Rundown">The Rundown</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Day_on_the_Block" title="Bad Day on the Block">Bad Day on the Block</a></i>) (b. 1948)<sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-232"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>232<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li>February 4

<li>February 5

<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Earl" title="Tony Earl">Tony Earl</a>, 86, politician, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Wisconsin" title="Governor of Wisconsin">governor of Wisconsin</a> (19831987) and member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisconsin_State_Assembly" title="Wisconsin State Assembly">Wisconsin State Assembly</a> (19691975) (b. 1936)<sup id="cite_ref-353" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-353"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>353<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_H._Lee_(businessman)" title="Thomas H. Lee (businessman)">Thomas H. Lee</a>, 78, financier, founder of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_H._Lee_Partners" title="Thomas H. Lee Partners">Thomas H. Lee Partners</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Equity_Partners" title="Lee Equity Partners">Lee Equity Partners</a> (b. 1944)<sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-354"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>354<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Olver" title="John Olver">John Olver</a>, 86, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._House_of_Representatives" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. House of Representatives">U.S. House of Representatives</a> (19912013), member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts_Senate" title="Massachusetts Senate">Massachusetts Senate</a> (19731991) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts_House_of_Representatives" title="Massachusetts House of Representatives">House of Representatives</a> (19691973) (b. 1936)<sup id="cite_ref-355" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-355"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>355<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li>February 24
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Abourezk" title="James Abourezk">James Abourezk</a>, 92, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._House_of_Representatives" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. House of Representatives">U.S. House of Representatives</a> (19711973) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Senate" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. Senate">Senate</a> (19731979) (b. 1931)<sup id="cite_ref-357" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-357"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>357<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li>February 25

<li>February 26
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Holland" title="Terry Holland">Terry Holland</a>, 80, basketball coach (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_Cavaliers_men%27s_basketball" title="Virginia Cavaliers men's basketball">Virginia Cavaliers</a>) (b. 1942)<sup id="cite_ref-368" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-368"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>368<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li>February 27
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricou_Browning" title="Ricou Browning">Ricou Browning</a>, 93, actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creature_from_the_Black_Lagoon" title="Creature from the Black Lagoon">Creature from the Black Lagoon</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revenge_of_the_Creature" title="Revenge of the Creature">Revenge of the Creature</a></i>) and television director (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flipper_(1964_TV_series)" title="Flipper (1964 TV series)">Flipper</a></i>) (b. 1930)<sup id="cite_ref-372" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-372"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>372<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li>February 28
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Botticelli_(figure_skater)" title="Michael Botticelli (figure skater)">Michael Botticelli</a>, 63, Olympic figure skater (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Figure_skating_at_the_1980_Winter_Olympics#Pairs" title="Figure skating at the 1980 Winter Olympics">1980</a>) (b. 1959)<sup id="cite_ref-375" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-375"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>375<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<ul><li>March 1
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_E._Cooper_(general)" title="William E. Cooper (general)">William E. Cooper</a>, 93, major general (b. 1929)<sup id="cite_ref-380" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-380"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>380<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Donaldson" title="Ted Donaldson">Ted Donaldson</a>, 89, actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Tree_Grows_in_Brooklyn_(1945_film)" title="A Tree Grows in Brooklyn (1945 film)">A Tree Grows in Brooklyn</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adventures_of_Rusty" title="Adventures of Rusty">Adventures of Rusty</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Father_Knows_Best" title="Father Knows Best">Father Knows Best</a></i>) (b. 1933)<sup id="cite_ref-381" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-381"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>381<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Harrington_Elster" title="Charles Harrington Elster">Charles Harrington Elster</a>, 65, writer and broadcaster (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Way_with_Words" title="A Way with Words">A Way with Words</a></i>) (b. 1957)<sup id="cite_ref-382" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-382"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>382<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leon_Hughes" title="Leon Hughes">Leon Hughes</a>, 92, musician (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Coasters" title="The Coasters">The Coasters</a>) (b. 1930)<sup id="cite_ref-383" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-383"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>383<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dan_McGinn" title="Dan McGinn">Dan McGinn</a>, 79, baseball player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montreal_Expos" title="Montreal Expos">Montreal Expos</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Cubs" title="Chicago Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cincinnati_Reds" title="Cincinnati Reds">Cincinnati Reds</a>) (b. 1943)<sup id="cite_ref-384" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-384"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>384<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Richardson" title="Jerry Richardson">Jerry Richardson</a>, 86, football player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore_Colts" title="Baltimore Colts">Baltimore Colts</a>) and executive (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carolina_Panthers" title="Carolina Panthers">Carolina Panthers</a>) (b. 1936)<sup id="cite_ref-385" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-385"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>385<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>March 2
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lokenath_Debnath" title="Lokenath Debnath">Lokenath Debnath</a>, 87, Indian-born mathematician, founder of the <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Journal_of_Mathematics_and_Mathematical_Sciences" title="International Journal of Mathematics and Mathematical Sciences">International Journal of Mathematics and Mathematical Sciences</a></i> (b. 1935)<sup id="cite_ref-386" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-386"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>386<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Carolina_Catamounts_men%27s_basketball" title="Western Carolina Catamounts men's basketball">Phil Hopkins</a>, 73, basketball coach (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Carolina_Catamounts_men%27s_basketball" title="Western Carolina Catamounts men's basketball">Western Carolina Catamounts</a>) (b. 1949)<sup id="cite_ref-387" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-387"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>387<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodore_Kanamine" title="Theodore Kanamine">Theodore Kanamine</a>, 93, brigadier general (b. 1929)<sup id="cite_ref-388" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-388"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>388<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dell_Raybould" title="Dell Raybould">Dell Raybould</a>, 89, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idaho_House_of_Representatives" title="Idaho House of Representatives">Idaho House of Representatives</a> (20002018) (b. 1933)<sup id="cite_ref-389" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-389"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>389<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C._Paul_Robinson" title="C. Paul Robinson">C. Paul Robinson</a>, 81, physicist (b. 1941)<sup id="cite_ref-390" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-390"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>390<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayne_Shorter" title="Wayne Shorter">Wayne Shorter</a>, 89, jazz saxophonist (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miles_Davis_Quintet" title="Miles Davis Quintet">Miles Davis Quintet</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weather_Report" title="Weather Report">Weather Report</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Jazz_Messengers" title="The Jazz Messengers">The Jazz Messengers</a>), 12-time <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award" class="mw-redirect" title="Grammy Award">Grammy</a> winner (b. 1933)<sup id="cite_ref-391" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-391"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>391<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>March 3
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Everitt_Bryant" title="Barbara Everitt Bryant">Barbara Everitt Bryant</a>, 96, market researcher, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Director_of_the_United_States_Census_Bureau" title="Director of the United States Census Bureau">director of the United States Census Bureau</a> (19891993) (b. 1926)<sup id="cite_ref-392" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-392"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>392<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Garnett" title="Carlos Garnett">Carlos Garnett</a>, 84, Panamanian-born jazz saxophonist (b. 1938)<sup id="cite_ref-393" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-393"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>393<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sara_Lane_(actress)" title="Sara Lane (actress)">Sara Lane</a>, 73, actress (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Virginian_(TV_series)" title="The Virginian (TV series)">The Virginian</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Saw_What_You_Did" title="I Saw What You Did">I Saw What You Did</a></i>) (b. 1949)<sup id="cite_ref-394" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-394"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>394<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lindley_(musician)" title="David Lindley (musician)">David Lindley</a>, 78, musician (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaleidoscope_(American_band)" title="Kaleidoscope (American band)">Kaleidoscope</a>) and singer ("<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercury_Blues" title="Mercury Blues">Mercury Blues</a>") (b. 1944)<sup id="cite_ref-395" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-395"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>395<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Newton" title="Calvin Newton">Calvin Newton</a>, 93, gospel singer (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Oak_Ridge_Boys" title="The Oak Ridge Boys">The Oak Ridge Boys</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sons_of_Song" title="Sons of Song">Sons of Song</a>) (b. 1929)<sup id="cite_ref-396" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-396"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>396<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Sizemore" title="Tom Sizemore">Tom Sizemore</a>, 61, actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_Born_Killers" title="Natural Born Killers">Natural Born Killers</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat_(1995_film)" title="Heat (1995 film)">Heat</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saving_Private_Ryan" title="Saving Private Ryan">Saving Private Ryan</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Hawk_Down_(film)" title="Black Hawk Down (film)">Black Hawk Down</a></i>) (b. 1961)<sup id="cite_ref-397" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-397"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>397<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lou_Stovall" title="Lou Stovall">Lou Stovall</a>, 86, painter (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-398" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-398"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>398<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>March 4
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phil_Batt" title="Phil Batt">Phil Batt</a>, 96, politician, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Idaho" class="mw-redirect" title="Governor of Idaho">governor of Idaho</a> (19951999), member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idaho_House_of_Representatives" title="Idaho House of Representatives">Idaho House of Representatives</a> (19651967) and twice of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idaho_Senate" title="Idaho Senate">Senate</a> (b. 1927)<sup id="cite_ref-399" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-399"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>399<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Haimer" class="mw-redirect" title="Robert Haimer">Robert Haimer</a>, 69, musician (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barnes_%26_Barnes" title="Barnes &amp; Barnes">Barnes &amp; Barnes</a>) and songwriter ("<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish_Heads_(song)" title="Fish Heads (song)">Fish Heads</a>") (b. 1954)<sup id="cite_ref-400" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-400"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>400<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judith_Heumann" title="Judith Heumann">Judith Heumann</a>, 75, disability rights activist (b. 1947)<sup id="cite_ref-401" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-401"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>401<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Rhodes_(musician)" title="Michael Rhodes (musician)">Michael Rhodes</a>, 69, bass player (b. 1953)<sup id="cite_ref-402" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-402"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>402<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andre_Smith_(basketball,_born_1958)" title="Andre Smith (basketball, born 1958)">Andre Smith</a>, 64, basketball player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nebraska_Cornhuskers_men%27s_basketball" title="Nebraska Cornhuskers men's basketball">Nebraska Cornhuskers</a>) (b. 1958)<sup id="cite_ref-403" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-403"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>403<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Snyder" title="Donald Snyder">Donald Snyder</a>, 71, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pennsylvania_House_of_Representatives" title="Pennsylvania House of Representatives">Pennsylvania House of Representatives</a> (19812000) (b. 1951)<sup id="cite_ref-404" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-404"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>404<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spot_(producer)" title="Spot (producer)">Spot</a>, 72, record producer (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Damaged_(Black_Flag_album)" title="Damaged (Black Flag album)">Damaged</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milo_Goes_to_College" title="Milo Goes to College">Milo Goes to College</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zen_Arcade" title="Zen Arcade">Zen Arcade</a></i>) (b. 1951)<sup id="cite_ref-405" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-405"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>405<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>March 5
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francisco_J._Ayala" title="Francisco J. Ayala">Francisco J. Ayala</a>, 88, Spanish-born evolutionary biologist and philosopher (b. 1934)<sup id="cite_ref-406" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-406"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>406<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joanne_Elliott" title="Joanne Elliott">Joanne Elliott</a>, 97, mathematician (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-407" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-407"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>407<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Goodman" title="Bob Goodman">Bob Goodman</a>, 83, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Boxing_Hall_of_Fame" title="International Boxing Hall of Fame">Hall of Fame</a> boxing promoter (b. 1939)<sup id="cite_ref-408" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-408"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>408<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Griswold" title="Frank Griswold">Frank Griswold</a>, 85, clergyman, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_presiding_bishops_of_the_Episcopal_Church_in_the_United_States_of_America" title="List of presiding bishops of the Episcopal Church in the United States of America">presiding bishop of the Episcopal Church</a> (19982006) (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-409" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-409"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>409<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Hsieh" title="Tom Hsieh">Tom Hsieh</a>, 91, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco_Board_of_Supervisors" title="San Francisco Board of Supervisors">San Francisco Board of Supervisors</a> (19861997) (b. 1931)<sup id="cite_ref-410" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-410"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>410<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilkka_J%C3%A4rvi-Laturi" title="Ilkka Jrvi-Laturi">Ilkka Jrvi-Laturi</a>, 61, Finnish-born film director (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spy_Games" title="Spy Games">Spy Games</a></i>) (b. 1961)<sup id="cite_ref-411" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-411"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>411<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gary_Rossington" title="Gary Rossington">Gary Rossington</a>, 71, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame" title="Rock and Roll Hall of Fame">Hall of Fame</a> guitarist (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lynyrd_Skynyrd" title="Lynyrd Skynyrd">Lynyrd Skynyrd</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rossington_Collins_Band" title="Rossington Collins Band">Rossington Collins Band</a>) (b. 1951)<sup id="cite_ref-412" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-412"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>412<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_Wills_(sportscaster)" title="Dave Wills (sportscaster)">Dave Wills</a>, 58, sportscaster (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tampa_Bay_Rays" title="Tampa Bay Rays">Tampa Bay Rays</a>) (b. 1964)<sup id="cite_ref-414" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-414"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>414<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>March 6

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="April">April</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2023_deaths_in_the_United_States&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: April"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>

<ul><li>April 1
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Abrams" title="Leonard Abrams">Leonard Abrams</a>, 68, journalist (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Village_Eye" title="East Village Eye">East Village Eye</a></i>) (b. 1954)<sup id="cite_ref-561" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-561"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>561<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kwame_Brathwaite" title="Kwame Brathwaite">Kwame Brathwaite</a>, 85, photojournalist and activist (b. 1938)<sup id="cite_ref-562" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-562"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>562<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alicia_Shepard" title="Alicia Shepard">Alicia Shepard</a>, 69, journalist and writer (b. 1953)<sup id="cite_ref-563" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-563"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>563<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Vinson" title="Roger Vinson">Roger Vinson</a>, 83, jurist, judge (since 1983) and chief judge (19972004) of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_Northern_District_of_Florida" title="United States District Court for the Northern District of Florida">U.S. District Court for Northern Florida</a> (b. 1940)<sup id="cite_ref-564" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-564"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>564<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>April 2
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toni_Elling" title="Toni Elling">Toni Elling</a>, 94, burlesque dancer (b. 1928)<sup id="cite_ref-565" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-565"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>565<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judy_Farrell" title="Judy Farrell">Judy Farrell</a>, 84, actress (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M*A*S*H_(TV_series)" title="M*A*S*H (TV series)">M*A*S*H</a></i>) and screenwriter (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_Charles" title="Port Charles">Port Charles</a></i>) (b. 1938)<sup id="cite_ref-566" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-566"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>566<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Gilliam_(American_football)" title="Frank Gilliam (American football)">Frank Gilliam</a>, 89, football player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iowa_Hawkeyes_football" title="Iowa Hawkeyes football">Iowa Hawkeyes</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winnipeg_Blue_Bombers" title="Winnipeg Blue Bombers">Winnipeg Blue Bombers</a>) (b. 1934)<sup id="cite_ref-567" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-567"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>567<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seymour_Stein" title="Seymour Stein">Seymour Stein</a>, 80, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame" title="Rock and Roll Hall of Fame">Hall of Fame</a> music executive, co-founder of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sire_Records" title="Sire Records">Sire Records</a> (b. 1942)<sup id="cite_ref-568" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-568"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>568<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garn_Stephens" title="Garn Stephens">Garn Stephens</a>, 78, actress (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phyllis_(TV_series)" title="Phyllis (TV series)">Phyllis</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halloween_III:_Season_of_the_Witch" title="Halloween III: Season of the Witch">Halloween III: Season of the Witch</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sunshine_Boys_(1975_film)" title="The Sunshine Boys (1975 film)">The Sunshine Boys</a></i>) (b. 1944)<sup id="cite_ref-569" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-569"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>569<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>April 3
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_M._Barker" title="William M. Barker">William M. Barker</a>, 81, jurist, chief justice of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee_Supreme_Court" title="Tennessee Supreme Court">Tennessee Supreme Court</a> (19952009) (b. 1941)<sup id="cite_ref-570" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-570"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>570<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neal_Boenzi" title="Neal Boenzi">Neal Boenzi</a>, 97, photographer (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-571" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-571"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>571<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Finfer" title="David Finfer">David Finfer</a>, 80, film editor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Fugitive_(1993_film)" title="The Fugitive (1993 film)">The Fugitive</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_%26_Ted%27s_Bogus_Journey" title="Bill &amp; Ted's Bogus Journey">Bill &amp; Ted's Bogus Journey</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Santa_Clause_3:_The_Escape_Clause" title="The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause">The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause</a></i>) (b. 1942)<sup id="cite_ref-572" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-572"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>572<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heklina" title="Heklina">Heklina</a>, 54, drag queen and actor (b. 1968)<sup id="cite_ref-573" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-573"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>573<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_LaTour" title="Jane LaTour">Jane LaTour</a>, 76, labor activist and journalist (b. 1946)<sup id="cite_ref-574" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-574"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>574<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_McGrath" title="Roy McGrath">Roy McGrath</a>, 53, public official and fugitive, chief of staff to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Maryland" title="Governor of Maryland">governor of Maryland</a> (2020) (b. 1969)<sup id="cite_ref-575" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-575"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>575<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herb_Rule" title="Herb Rule">Herb Rule</a>, 87, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arkansas_House_of_Representatives" title="Arkansas House of Representatives">Arkansas House of Representatives</a> (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-576" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-576"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>576<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>April 4
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bartholomae" title="David Bartholomae">David Bartholomae</a>, 75, scholar (b. 1947)<sup id="cite_ref-577" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-577"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>577<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lance_Ten_Broeck" title="Lance Ten Broeck">Lance Ten Broeck</a>, 67, professional golfer and caddie (b. 1956)<sup id="cite_ref-725" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-725"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>725<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li></ul>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="May">May</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2023_deaths_in_the_United_States&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: May"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>

<ul><li>May 1
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dick_Burwell" title="Dick Burwell">Dick Burwell</a>, 83, baseball player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_Cubs" title="Chicago Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a>) (b. 1940)<sup id="cite_ref-726" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-726"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>726<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calvin_Davis" title="Calvin Davis">Calvin Davis</a>, 51, hurdler, Olympic bronze medalist (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1996_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_400_metres_hurdles" title="Athletics at the 1996 Summer Olympics  Men's 400 metres hurdles">1996</a>) (b. 1972)<sup id="cite_ref-727" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-727"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>727<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Delaplaine" title="Andrew Delaplaine">Andrew Delaplaine</a>, 73, novelist and screenwriter (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meeting_Spencer" title="Meeting Spencer">Meeting Spencer</a></i>) (b. 1949)<sup id="cite_ref-728" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-728"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>728<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Giambarba" title="Paul Giambarba">Paul Giambarba</a>, 94, graphic designer and cartoonist (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/This_Week_(magazine)" title="This Week (magazine)">This Week</a></i>) (b. 1928)<sup id="cite_ref-729" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-729"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>729<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Jordan_Neely" class="mw-redirect" title="Death of Jordan Neely">Jordan Neely</a>, 30, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Jackson_impersonator" title="Michael Jackson impersonator">Michael Jackson impersonator</a> and vagrant (b. 19921993)<sup id="cite_ref-730" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-730"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>730<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eileen_Saki" title="Eileen Saki">Eileen Saki</a>, 79, Japanese-born actress (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M*A*S*H_(TV_series)" title="M*A*S*H (TV series)">M*A*S*H</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splash_(film)" title="Splash (film)">Splash</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Policewomen_(film)" title="Policewomen (film)">Policewomen</a></i>) (b. 1943)<sup id="cite_ref-731" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-731"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>731<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marshall_S._Smith" title="Marshall S. Smith">Marshall S. Smith</a>, 85, educator (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-732" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-732"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>732<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>May 2
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Bryne" title="Barbara Bryne">Barbara Bryne</a>, 94, British-born actress (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bostonians_(film)" title="The Bostonians (film)">The Bostonians</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amadeus_(film)" title="Amadeus (film)">Amadeus</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two_Evil_Eyes" title="Two Evil Eyes">Two Evil Eyes</a></i>) (b. 1929)<sup id="cite_ref-733" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-733"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>733<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arun_Manilal_Gandhi" title="Arun Manilal Gandhi">Arun Manilal Gandhi</a>, 89, South African-born Indian-American author and political activist (b. 1934)<sup id="cite_ref-734" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-734"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>734<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>May 3
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Religion" title="Bad Religion">John Albert</a>, 58, musician (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_Death" title="Christian Death">Christian Death</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Religion" title="Bad Religion">Bad Religion</a>) and music journalist (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LA_Weekly" title="LA Weekly">LA Weekly</a></i>) (b. 1964)<sup id="cite_ref-735" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-735"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>735<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lance_Blanks" title="Lance Blanks">Lance Blanks</a>, 56, basketball player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit_Pistons" title="Detroit Pistons">Detroit Pistons</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minnesota_Timberwolves" title="Minnesota Timberwolves">Minnesota Timberwolves</a>) and general manager (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phoenix_Suns" title="Phoenix Suns">Phoenix Suns</a>) (b. 1966)<sup id="cite_ref-736" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-736"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>736<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dean_Corren" title="Dean Corren">Dean Corren</a>, 67, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vermont_House_of_Representatives" title="Vermont House of Representatives">Vermont House of Representatives</a> (19932001) (b. 1955)<sup id="cite_ref-737" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-737"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>737<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howard_Krongard" title="Howard Krongard">Howard Krongard</a>, 82, attorney, government official (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inspector_General_of_the_Department_of_State" title="Inspector General of the Department of State">inspector general of the Department of State</a>, 20052008), and lacrosse <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_National_Lacrosse_Hall_of_Fame_members" title="List of National Lacrosse Hall of Fame members">Hall of Fame</a> player (b. 1940)<sup id="cite_ref-738" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-738"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>738<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronald_Rene_Lagueux" title="Ronald Rene Lagueux">Ronald Rene Lagueux</a>, 91, jurist, judge of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_District_of_Rhode_Island" title="United States District Court for the District of Rhode Island">U.S. District Court for Rhode Island</a> (since 1986) (b. 1931)<sup id="cite_ref-739" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-739"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>739<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roland_Pattillo" title="Roland Pattillo">Roland Pattillo</a>, 89, gynecologic oncologist (b. 1933)<sup id="cite_ref-740" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-740"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>740<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>May 4
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(film)" title="Jurassic Park (film)">Bill Basso</a>, 60, special effects artist (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(film)" title="Jurassic Park (film)">Jurassic Park</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terminator_2:_Judgment_Day" title="Terminator 2: Judgment Day">Terminator 2: Judgment Day</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tremors_(1990_film)" title="Tremors (1990 film)">Tremors</a></i>) (b. 1962)<sup id="cite_ref-741" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-741"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>741<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jessie_Maple" title="Jessie Maple">Jessie Maple</a>, 76, cinematographer and film director (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Will_(1981_film)" title="Will (1981 film)">Will</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twice_as_Nice" title="Twice as Nice">Twice as Nice</a></i>) (b. 1947)<sup id="cite_ref-889" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-889"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>889<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_McGovern_(American_football)" title="Bill McGovern (American football)">Bill McGovern</a>, 60, football coach (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UCLA_Bruins_football" title="UCLA Bruins football">UCLA Bruins</a>) (b. 1962)<sup id="cite_ref-890" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-890"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>890<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvey_Pitt" title="Harvey Pitt">Harvey Pitt</a>, 78, lawyer, chairman of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Securities_and_Exchange_Commission" title="U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission">Securities and Exchange Commission</a> (20012003) (b. 1945)<sup id="cite_ref-891" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-891"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>891<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>May 31
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergio_Calder%C3%B3n" title="Sergio Caldern">Sergio Caldern</a>, 77, Mexican-born actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pirates_of_the_Caribbean:_At_World%27s_End" title="Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End">Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men_in_Black_(1997_film)" title="Men in Black (1997 film)">Men in Black</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ruins_(film)" title="The Ruins (film)">The Ruins</a></i>) (b. 1945)<sup id="cite_ref-892" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-892"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>892<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amitai_Etzioni" title="Amitai Etzioni">Amitai Etzioni</a>, 94, Israeli-born sociologist (b. 1929)<sup id="cite_ref-893" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-893"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>893<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Vincent" title="Gene Vincent">Dickie Harrell</a>, 82, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame_inductees" title="List of Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductees">Hall of Fame</a> drummer (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Vincent" title="Gene Vincent">Gene Vincent</a> and the Blue Caps) (b. 1940)<sup id="cite_ref-894" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-894"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>894<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> (death announced on this date)</li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Rogers" title="Gene Rogers">Gene Rogers</a>, 93, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Carolina_House_of_Representatives" title="North Carolina House of Representatives">North Carolina House of Representatives</a> (19872003) (b. 1929)<sup id="cite_ref-895" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-895"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>895<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li></ul>
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="June">June</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2023_deaths_in_the_United_States&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: June"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>

<ul><li>June 1
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billy_Ray_Adams" title="Billy Ray Adams">Billy Ray Adams</a>, 84, football player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ole_Miss_Rebels_football" title="Ole Miss Rebels football">Ole Miss Rebels</a>) (b. 1938)<sup id="cite_ref-896" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-896"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>896<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronald_L._Baker" title="Ronald L. Baker">Ronald L. Baker</a>, 85, folklorist (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-897" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-897"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>897<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Batayeh" title="Michael Batayeh">Michael Batayeh</a>, 52, comedian and actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breaking_Bad" title="Breaking Bad">Breaking Bad</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Dreamz" title="American Dreamz">American Dreamz</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AmericanEast" title="AmericanEast">AmericanEast</a></i>) (b. 1970)<sup id="cite_ref-898" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-898"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>898<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Melchert" title="Jim Melchert">Jim Melchert</a>, 92, artist (b, 1930)<sup id="cite_ref-899" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-899"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>899<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anna_Shay" title="Anna Shay">Anna Shay</a>, 62, socialite, businesswoman and television personality (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bling_Empire" title="Bling Empire">Bling Empire</a></i>) (b. 1960)<sup id="cite_ref-900" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-900"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>900<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Sullivan_(catcher)" title="John Sullivan (catcher)">John Sullivan</a>, 82, baseball player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit_Tigers" title="Detroit Tigers">Detroit Tigers</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Mets" title="New York Mets">New York Mets</a>) and coach (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toronto_Blue_Jays" title="Toronto Blue Jays">Toronto Blue Jays</a>) (b. 1941)<sup id="cite_ref-901" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-901"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>901<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cynthia_Weil" title="Cynthia Weil">Cynthia Weil</a>, 82, songwriter ("<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/On_Broadway_(song)" title="On Broadway (song)">On Broadway</a>", "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Make_Your_Own_Kind_of_Music" title="Make Your Own Kind of Music">Make Your Own Kind of Music</a>") (b. 1940)<sup id="cite_ref-902" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-902"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>902<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>June 2
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Bolin" title="Bob Bolin">Bob Bolin</a>, 84, baseball player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco_Giants" title="San Francisco Giants">San Francisco Giants</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Red_Sox" title="Boston Red Sox">Boston Red Sox</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milwaukee_Brewers" title="Milwaukee Brewers">Milwaukee Brewers</a>) (b. 1939)<sup id="cite_ref-903" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-903"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>903<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>

Hill</a>, 97, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Carolina_House_of_Representatives" title="North Carolina House of Representatives">North Carolina House of Representatives</a> (19922012) (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-1049" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1049"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1049<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryan_Mallett" title="Ryan Mallett">Ryan Mallett</a>, 35, football player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_England_Patriots" title="New England Patriots">New England Patriots</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston_Texans" title="Houston Texans">Houston Texans</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore_Ravens" title="Baltimore Ravens">Baltimore Ravens</a>) (b. 1988)<sup id="cite_ref-1050" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1050"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1050<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bobby_Osborne" title="Bobby Osborne">Bobby Osborne</a>, 91, bluegrass musician (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osborne_Brothers" title="Osborne Brothers">Osborne Brothers</a>) (b. 1931)<sup id="cite_ref-1051" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1051"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1051<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Sherman_(music_critic)" title="Robert Sherman (music critic)">Robert Sherman</a>, 90, radio broadcaster (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WFUV" title="WFUV">WFUV</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WQXR-FM" title="WQXR-FM">WQXR</a>), author, and music critic (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i>) (b. 1930)<sup id="cite_ref-1052" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1052"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1052<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhante_Vimalaramsi" title="Bhante Vimalaramsi">Bhante Vimalaramsi</a>, 76, Buddhist monk (b. 1946)<sup id="cite_ref-1053" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1053"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1053<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lilli_Vincenz" title="Lilli Vincenz">Lilli Vincenz</a>, 85, German-born gay rights activist (b. 1937)<sup id="cite_ref-1054" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1054"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1054<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>June 28
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Shannon_(radio_personality)" title="Bob Shannon (radio personality)">Bob Shannon</a>, 74, radio disc jockey (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WCBS-FM" title="WCBS-FM">WCBS-FM</a>) (b. 1948)<sup id="cite_ref-1055" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1055"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1055<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lowell_Weicker" title="Lowell Weicker">Lowell Weicker</a>, 92, politician, member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._House_of_Representatives" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. House of Representatives">U.S. House of Representatives</a> (19691971) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Senate" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. Senate">Senate</a> (19711989), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_Connecticut" class="mw-redirect" title="Governor of Connecticut">governor of Connecticut</a> (19911995) (b. 1931)<sup id="cite_ref-1056" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1056"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1056<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>June 29
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Arkin" title="Alan Arkin">Alan Arkin</a>, 89, actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Russians_Are_Coming,_the_Russians_Are_Coming" class="mw-redirect" title="The Russians Are Coming, the Russians Are Coming">The Russians Are Coming, the Russians Are Coming</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Scissorhands" title="Edward Scissorhands">Edward Scissorhands</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Miss_Sunshine" title="Little Miss Sunshine">Little Miss Sunshine</a></i>), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Supporting_Actor" title="Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor">Oscar</a> winner (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/79th_Academy_Awards" title="79th Academy Awards">2006</a>) (b. 1934)<sup id="cite_ref-1057" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1057"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1057<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monte_Cazazza" title="Monte Cazazza">Monte Cazazza</a>, 68, industrial musician (b. 1954)<sup id="cite_ref-1058" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1058"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1058<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Kennedy" title="Don Kennedy">Don Kennedy</a>, 93, radio broadcaster (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WPIC" title="WPIC">WPIC</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBC_Radio" class="mw-redirect" title="NBC Radio">NBC Radio</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WWPW" title="WWPW">WWPW</a>), television personality (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WSB-TV" title="WSB-TV">WSB-TV</a>), and voice actor (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Ghost_Coast_to_Coast" title="Space Ghost Coast to Coast">Space Ghost Coast to Coast</a></i>) (b. 1930)<sup id="cite_ref-1059" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1059"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1059<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christine_King_Farris" title="Christine King Farris">Christine King Farris</a>, 95, civil rights activist (b. 1927)<sup id="cite_ref-1060" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1060"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1060<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvin_Kitman" title="Marvin Kitman">Marvin Kitman</a>, 93, television critic (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newsday" title="Newsday">Newsday</a></i>) and humorist (b. 1929)<sup id="cite_ref-1061" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1061"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1061<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anita_Wood" title="Anita Wood">Anita Wood</a>, 85, recording artist, TV performer and girlfriend of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Presley" title="Elvis Presley">Elvis Presley</a> (b. 1938)<sup id="cite_ref-1062" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1062"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1062<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>June 30
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Droz_(wrestler)" title="Droz (wrestler)">Droz</a>, 54, professional wrestler (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WWE" title="WWE">WWF</a>) and football player (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denver_Broncos" title="Denver Broncos">Denver Broncos</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montreal_Alouettes" title="Montreal Alouettes">Montreal Alouettes</a>) (b. 1969)<sup id="cite_ref-1063" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1063"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1063<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rick_Froberg" title="Rick Froberg">Rick Froberg</a>, 55, musician (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drive_Like_Jehu" title="Drive Like Jehu">Drive Like Jehu</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hot_Snakes" title="Hot Snakes">Hot Snakes</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obits" title="Obits">Obits</a>) (b. 1968)<sup id="cite_ref-1064" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1064"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1064<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrence_W._Jones" title="Lawrence W. Jones">Lawrence W. Jones</a>, 97, physicist and academic (b. 1925)<sup id="cite_ref-1065" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1065"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1065<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laird_Koenig" title="Laird Koenig">Laird Koenig</a>, 95, author (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Little_Girl_Who_Lives_Down_the_Lane_(novel)" title="The Little Girl Who Lives Down the Lane (novel)">The Little Girl Who Lives Down the Lane</a></i>) and screenwriter (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloodline_(1979_film)" title="Bloodline (1979 film)">Bloodline</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inchon_(film)" title="Inchon (film)">Inchon</a></i>) (b. 1927)<sup id="cite_ref-1066" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1066"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1066<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul></li></ul>

<li>July 26
